Class MemSeg

  • java.lang.Object
    • MemSeg

  • public class MemSeg
extends java.lang.Object
    MemSeg.java MemSeg implements a basic construct for memory segments in the context of operating systems.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemSeg(int id, int size)
      Sole constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getSegID()
      Returns the current memory segment ID number.
      int getSegSize()
      Returns the current memory segment size (in MB)
      boolean isInUse()
      Returns whether or not the memory segment has a job stored in it.
      void setUse(boolean b)
      This is used to set the memory segment to be in use or not.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MemSeg

        public MemSeg(int id,
      int size)
        Sole constructor. For invocation by superclass, typicaly explicit. Segment inUse will be set to false by default.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID number this segment will have
        size - the memory size (in MB) this segment should have

    • Method Detail

      • isInUse

        public boolean isInUse()
        Returns whether or not the memory segment has a job stored in it.
        Returns:
        true if segment is in use. Otherwise, false.

      • getSegID

        public int getSegID()
        Returns the current memory segment ID number.
        Returns:
        segID

      • getSegSize

        public int getSegSize()
        Returns the current memory segment size (in MB)
        Returns:
        memory segment size

      • setUse

        public void setUse(boolean b)
        This is used to set the memory segment to be in use or not.
        Parameters:
        b - whether or not the memory is being used.
